org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity
Class AeActivityOnEventScopeImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.AeActivityImpl
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.AeActivityScopeImpl
              org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.AeActivityOnEventScopeImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeActivity, IAeActivityParent, IAeBpelObject, IAeCompensatableActivity, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLocatableObject, IAeMessageDispatcher, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
public class AeActivityOnEventScopeImpl
extends AeActivityScopeImpl
implements IAeMessageDispatcher

Special version of a scope that appears within a WS-BPEL onEvent. The impl is created each time a message arrives within the onEvent. The execution of this scope calls back into the scope in order to consume the message. This is driven by the scope because the consumption of the message may involve initiating partner links or correlation sets that are defined by this scope. As such, the message consumption must be deferred until the scope is ready to execute. Also, any errors consuming the message must be handled first by this scope.

Field Detail

mMessageData

private IAeMessageData mMessageData
message data received by the onEvent. This will remain set until the scope executes, at which time it is cleared.

mMessageContext

private IAeMessageContext mMessageContext
context for the message data received by the onEvent. This will remain set until the scope executes, at which time it is cleared.

onFault

public void onFault(IAeFault aFault)
             throws AeBusinessProcessException
Records the fault locally and queues the scope. We still need to queue the scope through the process since the scope may be isolated and require locks prior to executing its fault handlers
